elements.title: Future homes standard
elements.description: UK govt ambitious uplift in the energy efficiency of new homes. [In Nov 2021](https://www.edie.net/news/11/Boris-Johnson-confirms-mandatory-EV-charging-points-for-new-buildings-in-England/) PM Johnson delivered a speech to the Confederation of British Industry (CBI) announcing mandatory EV charging points for new buildings in England

elements.title: Heat and buildings strategy
elements.description: This strategy sets out how the UK will decarbonise our homes, and our commercial, industrial and public sector buildings, as part of setting a path to net zero by 2050.

elements.title: Greening Finance: A Roadmap to Sustainable Investing
elements.description: This document sets out the government’s ambition to make the UK the best place in the world for green and sustainable investment.

elements.title: New 5-year SolarPower Europe Market Outlook
elements.description: The forecast for household solar continues to look bright for coming years, with European solar & storage set to grow over 400%, from 3 GWh installed storage capacity in 2020 to 12.8 GWh in 2025. SolarPower Europe has published its annual ‘European Market Outlook for Residential Battery Storage’ report, covering 2021-2025.

elements.title: storage-friendly changes to commercial, industrial and utility-scale clean energy policies
elements.description: The UK will exempt solar PV, energy storage and other clean energy technologies from business rate rises — the charges levied on non-domestic properties to pay for local services — from April 2023. [Business Rates Review Report](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/1028478/BRR_final.pdf), October 2021
